revised_title: Demonstration of the Theorem of Polarized Light Vibrations
tldr: In this letter, Professor Haidinger explains his demonstration of the theorem that in a ray of polarized light, the vibrations are perpendicular to the plane of polarization. He uses dichroitic crystals, such as tourmaline, sapphire, and idocrase, to show that the vibrations are not in the plane of polarization, as some other mathematicians have claimed. This discovery helps to understand the nature of polarized light and its applications in crystal optics.
